Detailed Description

This file defines abstract class for communication with Thermal Expert.

Function Documentation

◆ ApplyColorMap()

I3_LIB_API void i3::ApplyColorMap ( unsigned char *  dst,
unsigned char *  src,
int  color,
int  width,
int  height 
)

Apply color to input image.

Parameters
dst: output image (24bit color image, brg888)
src: input image (8bit gray image)
color: colormap to apply. its value ranges from I3_COLORMAP_WHITEHOT to I3_COLORMAP_RAINBOW.
width: width of image
height: height of image
Remarks
: This function convert 8 bit input gray image to 24 bit (bgr888) color image. Supported colormaps are whitehot, blackhot, iron, bluered, medical, purple, purpleyellow, darkblue, cyan, and rainbow.
: Since received image from Thermal Expert is 16 bit, it needs to be converted to 8 bit image before applay this function.

◆ OpenTE_A()

I3_LIB_API TE_A* i3::OpenTE_A ( int  hnd_dev)

Connect Thermal Expert of Type A model.

Parameters
hnd_dev: device number for TE to connect
Returns
nullptr : fail to open TE.
TE_A*(not nullptr) : pointer of TE_A class
Remarks
This function get TE device handle and make TE ready to communicate with host. It must be called to communicate with TE.

◆ OpenTE_B()

I3_LIB_API TE_B* i3::OpenTE_B ( int  _model,
int  hnd_dev 
)

Connect Thermal Expert of Type B model.

Parameters
_model: Indicator for TE model. Set I3_TE_Q1 for Q1, I3_TE_V1 for V1 and I3_TE_Q2 for Q2.
hnd_dev: Device number for TE to connect
Returns
nullptr : fail to open TE.
TE_B*(not nullptr) : pointer of TE_B class
Remarks
This function get TE device handle and make TE ready to communicate with host. After connection, calibration data will be read from flash memory to create image. It may take few seconds.
This function must be called to communicate with TE.

◆ RegisterTE()

I3_LIB_API bool __cdecl i3::RegisterTE ( HWND  hwnd)

Register TE device to get PNP information.

Parameters
hwnd: A handle to the window that will receive device events.
Returns
true : succeed in register
false : failed to register
Remarks
: This function register device for PNP notification. To get PNP information, call this function once when initialize program

◆ ScanTE()

I3_LIB_API int i3::ScanTE ( SCANINFO *  pDevCon)

Check connected TE.

Parameters
pDevCon: Buffer to get scan results. It should MAX_USB_NUM size array.
Returns
1 : Scan successfully
Otherwise : Failed to scan
Remarks
This function scans connected TE and return the results. The result contains connected devices's ID, Product Model, and device number.
For each connected TE, a device number(0 ~ MAX_USB_NUM - 1) is assigned. TE which has device number i corresponeds to i-th element of pDevCon and its scaned result is stored in i-th element of pDevCon. This device number is used in other function as hnd_dev.

◆ UnregisterTE()

I3_LIB_API void __cdecl i3::UnregisterTE ( )

Unregister TE.

Remarks
: This function unregister device. call this function when PNP information is not required

◆ WindowProcTE()

I3_LIB_API int __cdecl i3::WindowProcTE ( UINT  iMsg,
WPARAM  wParam,
LPARAM  lParam 
)

Check TE connection.

Parameters
iMsg: USB connection is changed or not
wParam: TE is removed or arrived
lParam: device information
Returns
1 : TE is arrived successfully
2 : TE is arrived but driver is not opened successfully
3 : TE is removed successfully
Remarks
This function checks TE connection. Insert this function in WindowProc function of MFC dialog. Then it will return 1 if TE is connected through usb port and return 3 if TE is removed from usb port.
